summary: This bill, the Frederick Douglass Trafficking Victims Prevention and Protection Reauthorization Act of 2025, reauthorizes and amends the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000. It modifies grant programs, amends tier standards for countries, addresses counter-trafficking in foreign assistance, clarifies nonhumanitarian aid definitions, and adds provisions related to organ harvesting. The bill also includes modifications to reporting requirements and extends authorizations for various programs combating trafficking.
